author: Special Correspondent
text:
The finals of the Thyrocare presents The Hindu Young World painting competition will be held at the Thiagarajar Polytechnic College here on Sunday. The event is an integral part of the NIE programme of The Hindu .

The finals will start at 9.30 a.m. and the shortlisted students should report at the venue by 9 a.m. Intimation letters have already been sent to the selected students through emails and the students should bring them to the venue along with the school identity card.

The topics for the finals and the painting sheet will be given at the venue and the contestants should bring with them all other materials needed for painting. The decision of the judges will be final and binding on all contestants. The paintings will become the sole property of The Hindu and will not be given back to the contestants. Besides prizes for the top three in each category, consolation prizes will also be given. Dr. Vinodhini Kirupakaran, clinical child psychologist, is the chief guest at the valediction and will distribute prizes to the winners at 12.30 p.m. at the same venue. Other finalists will be given participation certificates.

The preliminary round of competitions was held in two categories – Juniors: students of class IV to VI and seniors: classes VIII and IX. The response was overwhelming from both the categories.

Thyrocare is the presenting sponsor for the contest.
title: The Hindu Young World painting competition finals today
